page.title: 06Knitting
page.content: Unst is famous for it's lace-weight knitting. The best nape wool was 'rooed',plucked by hand from the Shetland sheep,then carded and spun to make a 2-ply yarn.Traditional patterns were used in knitting wedding veils, christening robes and stoles. Although there is a revival of interest in spinning,lace wool now usually comes from Brora Mills. It may take many weeks to knit a shawl.Cockleshell scarfs take 15 hours to knit. Jumpers,gloves,scarves,berets and hats are knitted in traditional Fair Isle patterns using 2-ply wool,most of which comes from the mills. Hand knitting has largely been superseded by machine knitting which is much quicker and increasingly sophisticated.Knitting provides a useful income in many households.
